oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Dia!kwain (David Hoesar) (V)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: About the Baboons and the Quagga, who were formerly people when those who are now people were not alive. Even though they are animals their organs still smell like they did when they were people. 1) p.5880v: this story was told to Dia!kwain by his mother (â‰ kamme-an), 2) Date on p.5881v: 29 January 1876, 3) pp.5881v & 5882v: the quagga and the baboon feel they are people and not game and thus their organs smell of people, 4) This story is found in Book V-23.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Lucy Lloyd |xam notebooks
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Baboons and quagga are people
